revision.text: {{VariableTemplate |Label=Power plant use rules |Description=Rules determining how different types of power plants are used. |Dimension=time, region |Unit=- |VariableType=external parameter |BasedOn2=Various sources |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Model-Database= }}

revision.comment: Text replace - "Marginal abatement cost" to "Marginal abatement costs"
revision.text: {{VariableTemplate |Label=Marginal abatement costss |Description=Cost of an additional unit of pollution abated (CO2eq). A marginal abatement cost curve (MAC curve) is a set of options available to an economy to reduce pollution, ranked from the lowest to highest additional costs. |Dimension=time, region |Unit=$/GJ |VariableType=model (from/to model) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= |Model-Database= |ExternalModelDriver= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Water stress |ShortDescription=Water stress expressed as the ratio of mean annual water demand to availability, aggregated to basin level (0.2-0.4 medium water stress; >0.4 severe water stress). |Description=Water stress is a basin scale indicator of the mean annual water demand to availability ratio. This ratio gives an indication for the level of water stress experienced in the basin. Basins with a water demand to availability ratio above 0.2 are considered medium water stressed, basins with ratios above 0.4 are severely water stressed. |Dimension=time, worldgrid |VariableType=model (end-indicator) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= |Model-Database= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=bias corrected daily climate input. |Description=Bias corrected daily precipitation, temperature and potential evaporation input. This data set is according to the monthly Precipitation and Temperature. |Dimension=time, worldgrid |VariableType=external parameter |Source2=EU-watch database }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Demand for primary energy |Description=Total demand for energy production. Sum of final energy demand and energy inputs into energy conversion processes. |Dimension=time, region, energy carrier |Unit=PJ |VariableType=model (from/to model) }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Road map |Description=Global road map. |Dimension=time |VariableType=external parameter |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Model-Database= |ExternalModelDriver= }} This dataset is based on the Digital Chart of the World (DCW). Digital Chart of the World thematic layers are: Political/Ocean (country boundaries), Populated Places (urbanized areas and points), Roads, Railroads, Aeronautical Structures, Utilities (electrical, telephone, pipelines), Drainage System, Hypsographic Data, Land Cover, Ocean Features, Physiography, Cultural Landmarks, Transportation Structure, Vegetation
See for more information: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digital_Chart_of_the_World
We are working on substituting the DCW road map with the GRIP road map (see http://intranet.pbl.nl/dataportaal/explorer/open-metadata.php?bestand=Wereld/Infrastructuur/PBL_GRIP_global_roads_vs2_2009.lyr.xml)

page.title: Expected value of affected GDP - grid

revision.text: {{VariableTemplate |Label=Affected GDP |Description=GDP expected to be exposed to floods per year. |Dimension=time, region, worldgrid |Unit=US$ |VariableType=model (end-indicator) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= |Model-Database= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=HDI (human development index) |Description=HDI: Development level of a country based on income, education and life expectancy. |Dimension=time, region |Unit=none |VariableType=model (end-indicator) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= |Model-Database= }} * from 2,2 documentation The human development index (developed by UNDP) representing the development level of a country based on three components: income, education and longevity.
The HDI contains the following three dimensions:
#life expectancy at birth, representing a long and healthy life # educational attainment, representing knowledge # real gross domestic product (GDP in purchasing power parity, PPP dollars). This represents a decent standard of living.

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Coastal storm surges |Description=Estimates on storm surge/tide water levels for a large number of coast segments. |Dimension=worldgrid, other |Unit=meter |VariableType=external parameter |Source2=DIVA model |Reference2=Hinkel and Klein, 2009 }}

page.title: Initial land cover, land use - grid

revision.comment: Oostenrijr moved page [[Initial land cover, land use]] to [[Initial land cover, land use - grid]] without leaving a redirect: Text replace - "Initial land cover, land use" to "Initial land cover, land use - grid"
revision.text: {{VariableTemplate |ShortDescription=Initial high resolution land cover and land use based on NDVI (Normalised Difference Vegetation Index). |Description=Includes current state (intensive agriculture use, extensive agricultural use, no use) of land area and erosion protection represented by greenness index (NDVI = Normalized Difference Vegetation Index). |VariableType=external parameter |Source2=GlobCover database; |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Secondary energy price |ShortDescription=Secondary energy price |Description=The secondary energy price of each energy carrier at the end-use level (coal, oil, gas, bio-energy, electricity, hydrogen) is calculated based on (1) the primary energy price, (2) energy taxes and subsidies, (3) the costs of energy conversion throughout the energy supply chain and (4) a correction factor. |VariableType=model (from/to model) }} The primary energy price is calculated endogenously, based on depletion, technology learning and a second calibration factor to correct for price influences other than production costs, such as periods of geopolitical instability. These primary energy prices are calibrated to historically observed primary energy prices.
Energy taxes and subsidies are added explicitly at both the primary and end-use level and come from IEA data sources.
The cost of energy conversion is determined in the subsequent energy conversion modules. One of these modules is the electricity power generation module that add the costs of building power plants, electricity transmission or energy losses. Other conversion modules are the hydrogen and bio-energy module.
The correction factor is used to calibrate the endogenously calculated secondary prices to observed (historical) fuel prices.

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Primary energy price |Description=The price of primary energy carriers based on production costs. |Dimension=time, region, energy carrier |Unit=$/GJ |VariableType=model (from/to model) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= |Model-Database= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Income-emission factors relationships |Description=Relationship between GDP and emission factors. |Dimension=time, region |VariableType=external parameter |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Model-Database= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Topography |Description=Topography and altitude, determining the altitude range within a grid cell. |Dimension=worldgrid |VariableType=external parameter |Source2=GLOBE Digital Elevation Model |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |ExternalModelDriver= |Model-Database= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Adaptation level |Description=Level of adaptation to climate change , defined as the share of climate change damage avoided by adaptation. This level is be calculated by the model to minimise adaptation costs and residual damage, or set by the user. |Unit=US$ (2005) per year |VariableType=driver |DriverGroup=Environmental and other policies |BasedOn=own assumpions; optimisation }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Child mortality |Description=he probability per 1,000 that a new-born baby will die before reaching the age five, if subject to average age-specific mortality rates. |Dimension=time, region |Unit=Deaths per 1,000 live births |VariableType=model (end-indicator) }}
{{VariableTemplate |Label=Demand |Description=Demand per sector including various crop and livestock sectors. |Dimension=time, region |Unit=% change |VariableType=model (end-indicator) }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Fraction cut down |Description=The fraction of forest harvested in a grid, in clear cutting, selective cutting, wood plantations and additional deforestation. Fraction of selective cut determines the fraction of timber harvested by selective cutting of trees in semi-natural and natural forest. |VariableType=driver |DriverGroup=Technological change in agriculture and forestry |BasedOn=Own estimates, based on FAO }}

revision.comment: Created page with "{{VariableTemplate |Description=Basins with ratios above 0.4 are considered to be severely water stressed. Using the projected population in each grid cell, the number of peop..."

revision.text: {{VariableTemplate |Label=Production system mix for livestock |Description=Livestock production is distributed over two systems for dairy and beef production (intensive: mixed and industrial; extensive: pastoral grazing), and to three systems for pigs (backyard, intermediate, intensive) and poultry (backyard, boilers, laying hens) with specific intensities, rations and feed conversion ratios. |Dimension=time, region |VariableType=driver |DriverGroup=Technological change in agriculture and forestry |BasedOn=Own estimates |Reference=Bouwman et al., 2005; Lassaletta et al., 2019 }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Life expectancy |Description=Average life expectancy of a person born in a given year.. |Dimension=time, region |VariableType=model (end-indicator) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= |Model-Database= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Land cover data from GLC2000 |ShortDescription=Land cover maps containing detailed, regionally optimised land cover classes for each continent, and a less detailed global classes harmonising across regional classes. |Description=The database contains two levels of land cover information—detailed, regionally optimized land cover legends for each continent and a less thematically detailed global legend that harmonizes regional legends into one consistent product. The land cover maps are all based on daily data from the VEGETATION sensor on-board SPOT 4. |Dimension=time, worldgrid, landcovertype |VariableType=external parameter |Source2=EC-JRC |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=GDP per capita per gridcell |Description=Scaled down GDP per capita from country to grid level, based on population density. |Dimension=time, worldgrid |Unit=per gridcell |VariableType=driver |DriverGroup=Economic development |BasedOn=Own downscaling }}

{{VariableTemplate |ShortDescription=Thirty land systems as defined in CLUMondo (Van Asselen and Verburg, 2012), characterized by specific levels of built-up area, cropland area, livestock density and management intensity. |Description=Thirty land systems as defined in CLUMondo, characterized by specific levels of built-up area, cropland area, livestock density and management intensity. |VariableType=model (from/to model) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= }}

revision.comment: Created page with "{{VariableTemplate |Label=Irrigation system |Description=Type of irrigation system: surface, sprinkler or drip. This is allocated at country level, based on Jagermeyr et al (2..."
revision.text: {{VariableTemplate |Label=Irrigation system |Description=Type of irrigation system: surface, sprinkler or drip. This is allocated at country level, based on Jagermeyr et al (2015). |Dimension=other |VariableType=driver |Reference=Jägermeyr et al., 2015 }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Decreased erosion risk |Description=Reduction in erosion risk by natural vegetation. |Dimension=time, worldgrid |VariableType=model (end-indicator) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= |ExternalModelDriver= |Model-Database= |ImpactIndicator= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=River discharge |Description=Annual statistics on river discharge. |Dimension=time, worldgrid |Unit=m<sup>3</sup> |VariableType=model (end-indicator) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= |Model-Database= }}

page.title: Actual crop and grass production - grid
N and P in wastewater discharge - grid

revision.text: {{VariableTemplate |Description=Discharge of N and P to surface water from wastewater. |Unit=kg |VariableType=model (end-indicator) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Irrigation project efficiency |Description=Ratio of quantity of irrigation water required by the crop (based on soil moisture deficits) to the quantity withdrawn from rivers, lakes, reservoirs or other sources. This parameter is given at country level. |Dimension=time |Unit=- |VariableType=driver |DriverGroup=Technological change in agriculture and forestry |Source=PIK |Reference=Rohwer et al., 2007 }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Commodity price |Description=Commodity price per sector, including various crop and livestock sectors.. |Dimension=time, region, sector |Unit=% change |VariableType=model (end-indicator) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= |Model-Database= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Description=Forest management type: clear cut, selective logging, forest plantation or additional deforestation. |Dimension=time, worldgrid |VariableType=model (from/to model) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= |Model-Database= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Description=Reduction in flood risk by natural vegetation. |Dimension=time, worldgrid |VariableType=model (end-indicator) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= |ExternalModelDriver= |Model-Database= |ImpactIndicator= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Radiative forcing |Description=Radiative forcing of greenhouse gases, ozone, and aerosols. |Dimension=time |VariableType=model (end-indicator) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= |Model-Database= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Crop production |Description=Regional production per crop. |Dimension=time, region, crops |VariableType=model (from/to model) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= |Model-Database= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Land Supply |Description=Available land for agriculture, per grid or region, depending on suitability for crops, and excluding unsuitable areas such as steep slopes, wetlands and protected areas. |Dimension=time, region |VariableType=model (from/to model) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Trade restrictions |Description=Trade tariffs and barriers limiting trade in energy carriers (in energy submodel). |Dimension=time, region |VariableType=driver |DriverGroup=Trade regimes, tariffs and barriers |BasedOn=Own assumptions }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Temperature |Description=Monthly average temperature. |Dimension=time, worldgrid |Unit=°C per month |VariableType=model (from/to model) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= |Model-Database= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Energy efficiency technology |Description=Model assumptions determining future development of energy efficiency. |Dimension=time, region |VariableType=driver |DriverGroup=Technological change in the energy system |BasedOn=Own assumptions }}

page.title: Demand for electricity, heat and hydrogen

revision.text: {{VariableTemplate |Label=Demand for electricity, heat and hydrogen |Description=The demand for production of electricity, heat and hydrogen. |Dimension=time, region |Unit=PJ |VariableType=model (from/to model) }}

{{VariableTemplate |Description=Rain water consumption by crops. |VariableType=model (end-indicator) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= |Model-Database= }}

revision.comment: Oostenrijr moved page [[Initial temperature, precipitation]] to [[Initial temperature, precipitation - grid]] without leaving a redirect: Text replace - "Initial temperature, precipitation" to "Initial temperature, precipitation - grid"
revision.text: {{VariableTemplate |Description=Global high resolution climate data from WorldClim. |VariableType=external parameter |Source2=WorldClim database |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Sector Value added |Description=Value Added for economic sectors: Industry (IVA), Services (SVA) and Agriculture (AVA). These variables are used in IMAGE to indicate economic activity. |Dimension=time, region |Unit=US$ (2005) per yr |VariableType=driver |DriverGroup=Economic development |BasedOn=Various sources }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=People dependent on solid fuel |Description=Proportion of population using traditional biomass and coal for cooking and heating. |Dimension=time, region |Unit=% |VariableType=model (from/to model) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= |Model-Database= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Exogenous market shares |Description=Market shares of traditional biomass and secondary heat, for all demand sectors except the residential sector, exogenous scenario parameter. |Dimension=time, region |Unit=- |VariableType=external parameter |Source2=IEA }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Animal productivity |Description=Effective production of livestock commodities per animal per year. |Dimension=time, region |VariableType=driver |DriverGroup=Technological change in agriculture and forestry |Source=FAOSTAT database |BasedOn=future: scenario assumptions }}

{{VariableTemplate |Description=Location, building year, purpose and size of 7000 largest reservoirs. |Dimension=time, worldgrid |VariableType=external parameter |Reference2=Lehner et al., 2011 |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3=Lehner et al., 2011 }}

{{VariableTemplate |Description=Emission projections and marginal abatement costs curves based on external models, such as the IIASA land-use models or the POLES database. |Unit=none |VariableType=external parameter |Source2=IIASA database; POLES database |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Description=Suitability of land in a grid cell for agriculture and forestry, as a function of accessibility, population density, slope and potential crop yields. |VariableType=model (from/to model) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Climate target |Description=Climate target, defined in terms of concentration levels, radiative forcing, temperature targets, or cumulative emissions. |Unit=Different units: respectively: ppm / w/m<sup>2</sup> / degrees celcius / Gigatonnes CO<sub>2</sub> equivalents |VariableType=driver |DriverGroup=Environmental and other policies |BasedOn=Own assumptions }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Monthly precipitation |Description=Monthly total precipitation. |Dimension=time, worldgrid |Unit=mm per month |VariableType=model (from/to model) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= |Model-Database= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Critical load |Description=Level of N deposition or concentration that should not be exceeded. |Dimension=time, worldgrid |Unit=g per m<sup>2</sup> |VariableType=external parameter |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Model-Database= |ExternalModelDriver= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Irrigation conveyance efficiency |Description=Ratio of water supplied to the irrigated field to the quantity withdrawn from the water source, determining the quantity of water lost during transport. This parameter is defined at country level. |Dimension=time |VariableType=driver |DriverGroup=Technological change in agriculture and forestry |Source=PIK |Reference=Rohwer et al., 2007 }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Trade policy |ShortDescription=Assumed changes in market and non-market instruments that influence trade flows. |Description=Assumed changes in market and non-market instruments that influence trade flows, subject to WTO rules and country and region regulation. |VariableType=driver |DriverGroup=Trade regimes, tariffs and barriers |BasedOn=Own assumptions }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Energy resources |Description=Volume of energy resource per carrier, region and supply cost class (determines depletion dynamics). |Dimension=time, region, energy carrier |VariableType=driver |DriverGroup=Energy and land resources |Reference=Rogner, 1997;Mulders et al., 2006 }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Private consumption per capita |Description=Private consumption reflects expenditure on private household consumption. It is used in IMAGE as a driver of energy. |Dimension=time, region |Unit=US$ (2005) per yr |VariableType=driver |DriverGroup=Economic development |Source=The World Bank |BasedOn=future: exogenous input }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Sulphate patterns |Description=Patterns of climate change to compute non-linear regional radiative effects of sulphate aerosols. |VariableType=external parameter |Reference2=Schlesinger et al., 2000 |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3=Schlesinger et al., 2000 }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=N soil budget |Description=N budget in the soil, used to calculate fate of nitrogen in the soil-hydrology system and for determining emissions to the atmosphere. |Dimension=time, worldgrid |VariableType=model (end-indicator) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= |Model-Database= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Income, own- and cross- price elasticities of commodities and demand |Description=Assumptions on income and price elasticities of demand, substitution elasticities, and many other elasticities, |Dimension=time, region |VariableType=external parameter |Source2=GTAP database; |BasedOn2=GTAP database and own assumptions |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Model-Database= }}

page.title: Access to drinking water and sanitation

revision.text: {{VariableTemplate |Label=Access to drinking water and sanitation |Description=Percentage of the population with sustainable access to safe drinking water and basic sanitation. |Dimension=time, worldgrid |Unit=% |VariableType=model (end-indicator) }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Residual damage |Description=Climate change damage remaining after adaptation. |Dimension=time, region |Unit=US$ 2005 |VariableType=model (end-indicator) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Topography |Description=Global high resolution map of topography and elevation from NASA Shuttle Radar Topography Mission. Digital Elevation Model. |Dimension=worldgrid |VariableType=external parameter |Source2=HydroSHEDS database; |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |ExternalModelDriver= |Model-Database= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Energy policies |Description=Policy to achieve energy system objectives, such as energy security and energy access. |Dimension=time, region |VariableType=driver |DriverGroup=Environmental and other policies |BasedOn=Own assumptions }}

revision.comment: Created page with "{{VariableTemplate |Label=Environmental flow requirements |Description=Percentage of natural flow reserved for the environment. Determined according to the Variable Monthly Fl..."

revision.text: {{VariableTemplate |Label=Nr of wet days |Description=Number of days with a rain event, per month; assumed constant after the historical period |Dimension=time, worldgrid |Unit=nr |VariableType=historical data |Source2= |BasedOn2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3=CRU database |Model-Database= }}
{{VariableTemplate |Label=Atmospheric CO<sub>2</sub> concentration |Description=Atmospheric CO<sub>2</sub> concentration. |Dimension=time |Unit=ppm |VariableType=model (from/to model) }}

{{VariableTemplate |Description=Percentage of cloudiness per month; assumed constant after the historical period |Dimension=worldgrid |Unit=% |VariableType=historical data |Source3=CRU database |Reference3=Harris et al., 2013 }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Irrigation water withdrawal - grid |Description=Water withdrawn for irrigation, not necessarily equal to the withdrawal demand, because of limited water availability in rivers, lakes, reservoirs and other sources. |Dimension=time, worldgrid |Unit=mm per month |VariableType=model (from/to model) }}

page.title: GLWD (global lakes and wetlands database) - grid

revision.text: {{VariableTemplate |Label=Ammonia emissions |Description=Ammonia emissions from applied nitrogen fertiliser and manure. |Dimension=time, worldgrid |VariableType=model (end-indicator) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= |Model-Database= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Livestock ration |Description=Determines the feed requirements per feed type (food crops; crop residues; grass and fodder; animal products; scavenging), specified per animal type and production system (extensive/intensive/backyard/intermediate/intensive/broiler/laying hens). |Dimension=time, region |VariableType=driver |DriverGroup=Technological change in agriculture and forestry |BasedOn=Own estimates |Reference=Bouwman et al., 2005; Lassaletta et al., 2019 }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Flooded depth |Description=Annual statistics of water depth in flooded areas of a grid cell. |Dimension=time, worldgrid |Unit=meters |VariableType=model (from/to model) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= |Model-Database= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Description=Radiative forcing per greenhouse gas. |Unit=W m-2 / ppm |VariableType=external parameter |Source2=Forster et al., 2007 |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Model-Database= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Digital water network |Description=Digital water network DDM30 describing drainage directions of surface water, with each cell only draining into one neighbouring cell, organising cells to river basins. |Dimension=worldgrid |VariableType=external parameter |Reference2=Döll and Lehner, 2002 }}

{{VariableTemplate |Description=Atmospheric concentration of non-CO<sub>2</sub> greenhouse gases. |Dimension=time |VariableType=model (end-indicator) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= |Model-Database= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Forestry drivers |Description=Fraction of harvested wood used as product, the remainder being left as residues. Specified per biomass pool and forestry management type. |Dimension=time, region |VariableType=driver |DriverGroup=Technological change in agriculture and forestry |BasedOn=Various sources }} In principle the fraction is based on literature, applicable for sawlogs & paper/pulp tiber. For biofuel we assume a fraction = 1

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Grass requirement |ShortDescription=Grass requirement for ruminants (non-dairy cattle, dairy cattle, sheep and goats) in pastoral and mixed systems. |Description=Grass requirement; ruminants (nondairy cattle, dairy cattle, sheep and goats) are grazing animals, and part (in mixed systems) or most (pastoral systems) of their feed is grass, hay or other roughage; this grass requirement is calculated as a fraction of the total energy (feed) requirement. |Dimension=time, region |VariableType=model (from/to model) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= |Model-Database= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Potential natural vegetation |Description=Potential natural vegetation type/biome, based on distribution of plant functional types. |Dimension=time, worldgrid |VariableType=model (from/to model) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= }} For vegetation types see the [[Land cover types]] page

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Fish landings |Description=Fish landings according to statistics from "Sea around us". |Dimension=time, region |VariableType=external parameter |Reference2=Sea around us project, 2013; |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3=Sea around us project, 2013; |Model-Database= |ExternalModelDriver= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Labour supply |Description=Effective supply of labour input to support economic activities, taking into account the participation rate of age cohorts. |Dimension=time, region |VariableType=driver |DriverGroup=Economic development |BasedOn=Demographics: population by age cohort times participation rate, corrected for skill level }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Global emission pathway |Description=Global emission pathway consistent with a specific long-term climate target. |Unit=Multiple units possible: tonne CO<sub>2</sub> equivalent / ppm / W/m<sup>2</sup> |VariableType=model (end-indicator) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= |Model-Database= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Land for bioenergy - grid |Description=Land available for sustainable bioenergy production (abandoned agricultural land and non-forested land). |Dimension=time, worldgrid |VariableType=model (from/to model) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= |Model-Database= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Emission abatement |Description=Reduction in emission factors as a function of Climate policy. |Dimension=time, region |Unit=tonne CO2equivalent |VariableType=model (from/to model) }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Consumption loss |Description=Loss of private consumption due to mitigation and adaptation costs and residual damage. |Dimension=time, region |Unit=US$ (2005) per year or percentage (%) |VariableType=model (end-indicator) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= |Model-Database= }}

{{VariableTemplate |ShortDescription=Areas not recommended for tourists due to war, high poverty rates or poor safety conditions. |Description=Indicator to account for the fact that tourists do not visit countries in war, with high poverty rates or poor safety conditions. This index includes hunger, refugees, war, corruption, homocides and theft |VariableType=external parameter |Source2=The World Bank; |BasedOn2=World development indicators and global development finance |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Activity levels (combustion and production) |Description=Activity levels in the energy and industrial sector, per process and energy carrier, for example, the combustion of petrol for transport or the production of crude oil. |Dimension=time, region, sector |Unit=Various |VariableType=model (from/to model) }}
{{VariableTemplate |Label=Emission trading |Description=Emission credits traded between regions |Dimension=time, region |Unit=Mt CO<sub>2</sub> equivalent |VariableType=model (end-indicator) }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Fraction from non-forested land |Description=Fraction of traditional fuelwood from non-forestry sources, such as orchard, assumed to be 50% (low-income countries) and 68% (middle-income countries). |VariableType=external parameter |Source2=FAO; |Reference2=FAO, 2001a; FAO, 2008 |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3=FAO, 2001a; FAO, 2008 }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Technology development |Description=Learning curves and exogenous learning that determine technology development. |Dimension=time, region |VariableType=driver |DriverGroup=Technological change in the energy system |BasedOn=Scenario assumption based on various sources }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=MSA effect values |Description=Database on empirical relationships between environmental pressures and reduction in mean species abundance for terrestrial ecosystems. |VariableType=external parameter |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Model-Database= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Equity principles |Description=General concepts of distributive justice or fairness used in effort sharing approaches. Three key equity principles are: Responsibility (historical contribution to warming); capability (ability to pay for mitigation); and equality (equal emissions allowances per capita). |Unit=Percentage (%) |VariableType=driver |DriverGroup=Environmental and other policies |BasedOn=Expert judgement }}

revision.comment: Created page with "{{VariableTemplate |Label=Water consumption other sectors |Description=Total annual and monthly water consumption for households, industry and electricity. Consumption is defi..."

revision.text: {{VariableTemplate |Label=CO and NMVOC emissions |Description=Emissions from CO and NMVOC. |Dimension=time, region |Unit=Pg C/NMVOC yr<sup>-1</sup> |VariableType=model (from/to model) }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Terrestrial CO<sub>2</sub> emission |Description=Land-use CO<sub>2</sub> emissions from deforestation, wood harvest, agricultural harvest, bioenergy plantations and timber decay. |Dimension=time, region |Unit=ton C per ha per yr |VariableType=model (from/to model) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= |Model-Database= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Ocean carbon uptake |Description=Ocean carbon uptake. |VariableType=model (from/to model) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= |Model-Database= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Description=Extensive pasture with low productivity used for grazing. |Dimension=worldgrid |VariableType=model (from/to model) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Other crops |Description=Fraction of other, not modelled crops in agricultural area, assumed constant in the future. |Dimension=worldgrid |VariableType=external parameter |Source2=FAOSTAT database; |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Net Primairy Production - grid- |Description=CO<sub>2</sub> sequestered by plants and incorporated in new tissue in plant carbon pools. |Dimension=time, worldgrid |Unit=ton C per ha per yr |VariableType=model (from/to model) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= |Model-Database= }}

page.title: Weighting factors for temperature, precipitation, land use and slope

revision.text: {{VariableTemplate |Label=Preferences (costs mark-ups) |Description=Non-price factors determining market shares, such as preferences, environmental policies, infrastructure and strategic considerations, used for model calibration. |Unit=- |VariableType=driver |DriverGroup=Lifestyle parameters |BasedOn=Calibration; future: scenario assumptions }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Initial production costs |Description=The costs of energy conversion technologies at the start of the simulation. |Dimension=region |Unit=$/GJ |VariableType=external parameter |BasedOn2=Various sources |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Model-Database= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Management intensity crops |Description=Management intensity crops, expressing actual yield level compared to potential yield. While potential yield is calculated for each grid cell, this parameter is expressed at the regional level. This parameter is based on data and exogenous assumptions - current practice and technological change in agriculture - and is endogenously adapted in the agro-economic model. |Dimension=time, region, crops |Unit=- (without unit) |VariableType=model (from/to model) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Trade for all commodities |Description=Bilateral trade between regions per sector, including various crop and livestock sectors. |Dimension=time, region, sector |Unit=% change |VariableType=model (end-indicator) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= |Model-Database= }}

page.title: CO2 emission from energy and industry

revision.text: {{VariableTemplate |Label=P soil budget |Description=P budget in the soil, used to calculate fate of nitrogen in the soil-hydrology system (residual soil P or surface runoff). |Dimension=time, worldgrid |VariableType=model (end-indicator) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= |Model-Database= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Global mean temperature |Description=Average global temperature. |Dimension=time |Unit=degrees C |VariableType=model (from/to model) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=CO<sub>2</sub> stored |Description=The amount of CO<sub>2</sub> stored in underground reservoirs by applying CO<sub>2</sub> capture technology.. |Dimension=time, region |Unit=GtC |VariableType=model (end-indicator) }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Taxes and other additional costs |Description=Taxes on energy use, and other additional costs |Dimension=region |Unit=US$/GJ |VariableType=driver |DriverGroup=Environmental and other policies |Source=IEA |BasedOn=future: scenario assumptions }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=MAGICC parameter settings |Description=MAGICC 6.0 parameters calibrated to emulate one out of 19 climate models. |VariableType=external parameter |Source2=Meinshausen et al., 2011a |Reference2=Meinshausen et al., 2011a; |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3=Meinshausen et al., 2011a; |Model-Database= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Land cover |Description=Multi-dimensional map describing all aspects of land cover and land use per grid cell, such as type of natural vegetation, crop and grass fraction, crop management, fertiliser and manure input, livestock density. |Dimension=time, worldgrid |VariableType=model (from/to model) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= }} A description of land cover types in IMAGE can be found on the [[Land_cover_types]] page
{{VariableTemplate |Label=Electricity price |Description=The price of electricity. |Dimension=time, region |Unit=$/GJ |VariableType=model (from/to model) }}

{{VariableTemplate |Description=Intensively used grassland areas for grazing or mowing, at locations also suitable for crop production. |VariableType=model (from/to model) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Water demand other sectors |Description=Total annual water demand for non-agricultural sectors (households, industry and electricity production) |Dimension=time, worldgrid |Unit=l/d |VariableType=external parameter |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Model-Database= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Slope |Description=Terrain slope index. |Dimension=worldgrid |VariableType=external parameter |Source2=IIASA |Reference2=FAO, 2012a; |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3=FAO, 2012a; |ExternalModelDriver= |Model-Database= |ImpactIndicator= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Forest residues |ShortDescription=Residues from timber harvest, left in forest after harvest or used as bioenergy. |Description=Harvest losses (from damaged trees and unusable tree parts) or harvest residues that are left in the forest by purpose because of environmental concerns. These losses/residues remains in the forest after harvest, in in principle enter the soil pools. But they could also be used for other/energy purposes. |Dimension=time, worldgrid |VariableType=model (end-indicator) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= |Model-Database= }}

revision.comment: Text replace - "Prevalence of undernourishment" to "Underweight and undernourishment"
revision.text: {{VariableTemplate |Label=Underweight and undernourishment |Description=Proportion of the population with insufficient food intake to meet dietary energy requirements. |Dimension=time, worldgrid |VariableType=model (end-indicator) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= |Model-Database= }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Feed crop requirements |ShortDescription=Crops required for feeding livestock. |Description=Total amount of feed required for the production of animal products. Grass and fodder species are consumed by grazing animals only (dairy and non-dairy cattle, sheep and goats), while pigs and poultry are fed feed crops and other feedstuffs. |Dimension=time, region |VariableType=model (from/to model) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= |Model-Database= }}
{{VariableTemplate |Label=Demand of traditional biomass |Description=Regional demand for traditional bioenergy. |Dimension=time, region |Unit=PJ |VariableType=model (from/to model) }}

{{VariableTemplate |Label=Species Richness Index (SRI) |Description=Species richness calculated from MSA and species area curves. |Dimension=time, worldgrid |Unit=- |VariableType=model (end-indicator) |Source2= |BasedOn2= |Reference2= |DriverGroup= |Source= |BasedOn= |Reference= |Source3= |Reference3= |Model-Database= }}

This is the "testPropertyTemplate" template. returns true (<> 0) if page has property . reverse is optional and should be used as reverse=1 for reversed properties It should be called in the following format: 
{{PropertyTestTemplate
|prop=
|page=
|reverse=
}}
Edit the page to see the template text. {{#ifeq:{{{reverse|}}}|1 |{{#ask:[[{{{prop|}}}::{{{page|}}}]]|format=count}} |{{#ask:[[-{{{prop|}}}::{{{page|}}}]]|format=count}} }}

This is the "VariableTemplate" template. It should be called in the following format: 
{{VariableTemplate
|Label=
|Description=
|Dimension=
|Unit=
|VariableType=
|DriverGroup=
|Source=
|BasedOn
|Reference
|Source2=
|BasedOn2=
|Reference2=
